job_description: Embedded Engineer II - job post Assa Abloy 722 reviews Long Beach, CA $80,000 - $96,000 a year -  Part-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $80,000 - $96,000 a year Job Type Part-time Embedded Engineer II An Amazing Career Opportunity for an Embedded Engineer II Location: Long Beach, CA (Hybrid) Job ID: 17369 As a member of a collaborative engineering team, the embedded software systems engineer is needed to develop physical access control systems and communications drivers for our high-reliability product! Who are we? HID powers the trusted identities of the world’s people, places, and things, allowing people to transact safely, work productively and travel freely. We are a high-tech software company headquartered in Austin, TX, with over 4500 worldwide employees. Check us out here: www.hidglobal.com and https://youtu.be/23km5H4K9Eo HID’s PACS Business Area: HID Physical Access Control Systems (PACS), located in multiple development locations across the world, is recognized as the global leader in the design, manufacture, and supply of access control security technology. HID, the provider of trusted identities to the world's people, places, and things. A leader in the commercial security industry, this established company designs and manufactures physical access control systems. As our Embedded Engineer II , you’ll support HID’s success by: Developing and enhancing features for real-time embedded system. Creating DevOps related scripts for build automation CI/CD. Developing communications protocol drivers for use in our embedded system and third-party products. Developing and improving network communication mechanisms. Port existing software to new embedded hardware and software platforms. Designing and implementing software development and test tools. What we will love about your background: Experience in distributed systems and network-based communication protocols. Familiarity with the Microsoft Visual Studio and Eclipse development environments. Ability to work on complex tasks with minimal technical guidance. Excellent problem-solving, design, development, and debugging skills. Experience working with automation tools like Jenkins, Git in Agile/CI environment. Your Experience and Education include: Bachelor’s degree desired in relevant field (BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Computer Engineering). 2-4 years professional experience in C or C++ programming, preferably with Embedded Linux and microcontroller RTOS development. Preferred Qualifications: Professional experience in embedded Linux development. Knowledge of the GNU toolset. Experience with RTOS and high-reliability platforms. C, C++, TCP/IP, UDP, RS232, RS-485, SSL, TLS, XML, HTML, JSON, Web Services/REST, Containerization, and Virtual Machines Who you are as a Team Member: Ability to effectively communicate in the English language verbally and in writing. Ability to read and interpret technical journals, specifications, international technical standards, etc. On rare occasion, domestic and international travel to customer and partner sites for problem solving/analysis and integration may be asked of engineers. Must be able to work from office location in Long Beach, California when necessary. Why ? Empowerment: You’ll work as part of a global team in a flexible work environment, learning and enhancing your expertise. We welcome an opportunity to meet you and learn about your unique talents, skills, and experiences. You don’t need to check all the boxes. If you have most of the skills and experience, we want you to . Innovation: You embrace challenges and want to drive change. We are open to ideas, including flexible work arrangements, job sharing or part-time job seekers. Integrity: You are results-orientated, reliable, and straightforward and value being treated accordingly. We want all our employees to be themselves, to feel appreciated and accepted. The wage range for this role considers a broad scope of factors that are considered when making compensation decisions, including but not limited to: skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At HID, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. The base salary for CA is $80,000 to $96,000 per year. This opportunity may be open to flexible working arrangements. HID is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer – Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Gender Identity/Sexual Orientation. Application due 2023-05-22 Function Engineering & Science Experience level Associate Location Long Beach, California, United States
